channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Yes another caravan parked in Crawford Gardens This time with a random reg plate belonging to a Skoda??

item.title: Flat 42 Balin House, SE1 1YH (Ground Floor), 15th October
item.description:
A black suitcase has been sitting on the ground floor for a couple weeks now with a very strong stench that is resulting in a foul smell in the hallways. I am not sure what is inside the suitcase but it is a horrendous smell - presenting a health and safety hazard to the tenants

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Long Lane, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights coming on late, 15th October
item.description:
Westbourne passage between Westbourne Park Road and Westbourne villas 6pm it was pitch black walking along but 7.30 pm lights were on much better.Please could they come on earlier
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westbourne Park Passage, Bayswater, London

item.title: I am unable to lock my bike, 15th October
item.description:
I am unable to lock my bike outside Marks & Spencer‘s because the line bikes have taken all of the bike stands. The team inside Marks & Spencer‘s say that they have contacted the council multiple times about this because their customers can’t lock their bikes it’s so frustrating this is like the fifth time. Why are Lime allowed to use all of the bike stands when their bikes don’t even need locks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 446-450, Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots damaging driveway, 15th October
item.description:
The roots from the tree directly outside my property are pushing up the block paving on my drive causing damage and a trip hazard! Please can someone arrange to come and inspect the roots and arrange to remove the ones on my property. I have previously asked for this tree to be trimmed back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Chaucer Road, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Intercom doors not opening/locked out, 15th October
item.description:
Intercom doors not opening with fob or door number calling. We cannot get in to our homes unless a neighbour comes from their house to let us in. Having to press emergency exit from inside to open it
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Aden Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees from private land onto pavement - first reported 23rd July, 15th October
item.description:
Overhanging trees from private land onto pavement - first reported 23rd July - Closed by Bromley Council 1st August having served a 28 day notice Not resolved by 1st Sept New report raised due to Bromley having closed the last one - This report closed today with - Bromley Council having served a 28 day notice New report raised 14th Oct - closed 15th Oct by Bromley Council with Bromley Council having served another 28 day notice. It's been 75 days since you served the first notice and 83 days since the issue was first reported! Bromley council, stop sending letters which aren't being acted upon and make sure people can use the pavement instead of being forced into the road by these trees and parked cars! You've had nearly 3 months to get this sorted!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Station Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
